unnormalised: So, someone asked me about my Class 10 results. Hmmm... Well, let me tell you, it was a rollercoaster!
normalised: So, someone asked me about my Class ten results. Hmmm... Well, let me tell you, it was a rollercoaster!

unnormalised: I remember the day the results were announced. It was absolute chaos. The website kept crashing, typical, right? Everyone was refreshing like crazy. I finally managed to see mine after what felt like an eternity. I scored 88% overall. Math was my highest at 92, which was a relief, since I’d spent countless hours prepping. Science was next at 89, and then English at a surprising 85. Social Studies was a bit of a letdown at 82, probably because I kept mixing up dates and events. Hindi, surprisingly, was a solid 90.
normalised: I remember the day the results were announced. It was absolute chaos. The website kept crashing, typical, right? Everyone was refreshing like crazy. I finally managed to see mine after what felt like an eternity. I scored eighty eight percent overall. Math was my highest at ninety two, which was a relief, since I’d spent countless hours prepping. Science was next at eighty nine, and then English at a surprising eighty five. Social Studies was a bit of a letdown at eighty two, probably because I kept mixing up dates and events. Hindi, surprisingly, was a solid ninety.

unnormalised: I felt a mix of relief and slight disappointment, if I’m honest. My parents were happy, though, especially Mom. She'd been nagging me to study harder. Dad just smiled and said, "Good job, beta. Now focus on Class 11." Classic Dad! My friends were all over the place. Some were ecstatic with 95%+, others were stressed because they didn’t hit the 75% mark they needed for their desired stream. The whole thing felt a bit like a pressure cooker.
normalised: I felt a mix of relief and slight disappointment, if I’m honest. My parents were happy, though, especially Mom. She'd been nagging me to study harder. Dad just smiled and said, "Good job, beta. Now focus on Class eleven." Classic Dad! My friends were all over the place. Some were ecstatic with ninety five percent plus, others were stressed because they didn’t hit the seventy five percent mark they needed for their desired stream. The whole thing felt a bit like a pressure cooker.

unnormalised: Looking back, it's just a number. A big number, sure, but still just a number. It helped me get into the science stream I wanted at a decent junior college, but honestly, what I learned outside of textbooks—the friendships, the late-night study sessions, the panicking over exams—that’s what really shaped me.
normalised: Looking back, it's just a number. A big number, sure, but still just a number. It helped me get into the science stream I wanted at a decent junior college, but honestly, what I learned outside of textbooks—the friendships, the late-night study sessions, the panicking over exams—that’s what really shaped me.

unnormalised: Ultimately, my 10th result, that 88%, opened doors, but it wasn't the destination. It was just a stop along the way. And for anyone stressing about their results, remember that. Your marks don't define you. Your effort and what you learn along the way do.
normalised: Ultimately, my tenth result, that eighty eight percent, opened doors, but it wasn't the destination. It was just a stop along the way. And for anyone stressing about their results, remember that. Your marks don't define you. Your effort and what you learn along the way do.
